New Records: Since FIFA began its world rankings, no side has beaten an opponent as many places above it as Slovakia (48th) beating Belgium (second).
Key Match Events: Romelu Lukaku had two goals chalked out by VAR as Belgium slumped to a 1-0 defeat against Slovakia at Euro 2024.
Slovakia took an early lead courtesy of Ivan Schranz after Jeremy Doku gave away the ball near his own penalty area.
Lukaku thought he had equalised in the second half twice, but technology intervened to deny him, once for offside and once for a handball in the build-up.
A performance of discipline, aggression and intensity gave Slovakia a shock win over Belgium.
Ivan Schranz’s early goal was enough to snaffle the points.
Belgium started the game well with Jeremy Doku to the fore, but then on seven minutes, he passed the ball across his own box and it was intercepted, leading to Slovakia's goal.
Though Belgium were a little better in the second half, especially once Lois Openda came on, Romelu Lukaku had two strikes disallowed by VAR.
Slovakia defended well, recording their biggest win since beating Italy in the 2010 World Cup.
Post-Match Reflections: Domenico Tedesco refuses to criticise officials after Belgium loss to Slovakia.
Belgium will still back themselves to qualify for the last 16, but they have put themselves under pressure and looked a long way from contention.
Slovakia will fancy themselves to make the last 16 from here and rightly so, while Belgium and Domenico Tedesco in particular have much thinking to do.
Once upon a time, Belgium were a side with the potential to contend for trophies, but their golden generation have aged.
Tedesco might freshen up his XI with young players like Openda and Johan Bakayoko.
Slovakia played with greater moxie and desire, which turned out to be enough for the win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Lukas Haraslin was named Player of the Match for his constant menace and enterprise.
Player ratings for Belgium: Casteels 6, Castagne 5, Faes 6, Debast 6, Carrasco 5, Mangala 5, Onana 5, Trossard 5, De Bruyne 6, Doku 5, Lukaku 5. Subs: Bakayoko 6, Tielemans 6, Openda 7, Lukebakio 6.
Player ratings for Slovakia: Dubravka 7, Pekalik 7, Vavro 8, Skriniar 8, Hancko 8, Kucka 7, Lobotka 7, Duda 7, Schranz 7, Bozenik 8, Harslin 8. Subs: Strelec 6, Suslov 6, Duris 6, Obert 6.
